direction.raw_text: No Stephen. You didn't make a mistake. You made a choice. You called me and left a message to call back...that it was important. But when I did...you said to forget about it. You chose not to tell me. Why did you make that choice?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't think it was important.

direction.raw_text: Sure you did. But you went because you were curious, because you were flattered. Because it made you feel special to think Duffy wanted to speak to you instead of me. Because you thought to yourself: maybe I can get something out of this. Because it made you feel big. First campaign I ran tiny little race in Kentucky -state senate seat. Workin for redneck nobody named McGuthrie. Had no money, no staff, no fuckin office. Everyone thought we didn't stand a chance. There's no way we can compete. And about this time, a guy running a congressional campaign a few districts over gives me a call. Says, "I really like what you were able to do for poor ole' Sam. But let's face it, he's a goner, so why don't you come work for me?" What do I do? Well Stephen -this is where you and I are different. I told Sam about the call. And Sam says to me, "Paul, you think this other's guy's got a shot at winning, and he can pay you more than anything I can afford, so if it's what you feel you need to do, then I won't get in your way." So I say, "Sam -you took a chance and hired me when I was even more of nobody than you are, and I'd be damned if I'm gonna jump ship just because the shit hit the fan." We lost the race, but three years later, when Sam decided to run for Governor -who do you think he called? We won that race. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: And twenty years later I'm where I am now. (Beat) There's only one thing I value in this world Steve, and that's loyalty. Without it you're nothing and you have no one. And in politics it's the only currency that you can count on. That's why I'm letting you go. Not because you're not good enough. But I value trust over skill. And I don't trust you anymore.

The coroner has stated, that based on the evidence found by the police in the hotel room, that this was an accidental overdose, a lethal cocktail of alcohol and prescription drugs. The Cincinnati police chief, Darryl Mathews, has called for a full investigation pending a toxicology report which could take up to two weeks. Just a terrible terrible situation for the former Senator, now DNC Chairman, Jack Stearns and his family. Off the Governor's face we:

Make a fine story on the Sunday morning news cycle...so I expect to hear from you by noon tomorrow...or I endorse Pullman and take my cabinet seat. They look at each other.

direction.raw_text: . MORRIS (CONT'D) I don't think we have any of that information yet. Obviously there will be a full investigation. Just wanted to say that our hearts go out...our prayers go out to the entire family...and she was part of our family.

He pulls it from his pocket and reads the name of the caller. It reads "Molly." He looks up. Panic starts to set in - the only sounds we hear are his heart beating and the phone vibrating. The Governor looks at each of his staff members. Then he scans around the room looking through the press corps up to the back doorway where he locks eyes with Stephen.

direction.raw_text: Paul's gone today. I set a meeting with you and Thompson where you promise him the ticket. You get three hundred and fifty-six pledged delegates, you get North Carolina, and then you take office and make right what so many have made wrong. All the things we both believe in.

direction.raw_text: . MORRIS Well I don't believe in extortion...I don't believe in tying myself to you for the next eight years.

direction.raw_text: Four years, let's not get ahead of ourselves. A long beat. Finally the Governor says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MORRIS What were you doing in her room?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Housekeeping, before you ended up on page one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MORRIS No. You were already fired, you were out. What were you doing in her room?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was fixing a situation...I got a call, someone from the hotel thought I could help and called me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MORRIS You were off the campaign, but you thought it was important to come back and fix things? It was your voice on the phone the other night. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MORRIS (CONT'D) You were fucking her. What did you do Stephen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I loaned her some money and gave her a ride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MORRIS I bet you did. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MORRIS (CONT'D) There's no note.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, there's no note.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MORRIS Show it to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I brought it here? That's how people get hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MORRIS Okay let's play this out. You're not wearing a wire because everything you've suggested is illegal...and you wouldn't fare well in federal prison. You were fucking her and she told you about her situation. There are no records or conversations between us. And since she's had an abortion, no DNA evidence. So if there's no note, then it's your word against mine. Your word. A fired, disgruntled, employee, or a sitting governor...There's no note.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's your call Governor. As the Governor weighs his options we-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is sitting in a barber shop getting his hair cut... the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: cuts... Paul sits there. The TV is on... a sports show... no one talks. We watch Paul's face as the barber clips the back of his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks out, starts down the street. As he passes the first corner, he sees the Governor's SUV and the Secret Service SUV both parked on the side of the road. Paul looks at the SUV... then walks up to the window. The window rolls down and the GOVERNOR leans his head out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MORRIS Paul you got a minute? We stay outside the car for along time. We hear CHRIS MATHEWS under this shot. We see Paul get out of the SUV and the two SUVs drive off, leaving him standing there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NEXT DAY - ESTABLISHING INT. NICER HOTEL ROOM- CINCINNATI - NEXT DAY STEPHEN'S in a different hotel now. The TV is on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much could a big shake up days before the Ohio primary hurt a campaign. I asked Paul Zara how his firing could actually help the candidate. We See STEPHEN, shaving in the bathroom mirror, as he listens to the TV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Governor and I both felt, that in light of some of these changing numbers, it was best to put a new face on the campaign...Stephen is very talented...very smart...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see a shot of an old church. People are walking up the steps and through the big open doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're at a memorial service for Molly. We see a lot of young people. PAUL is sitting in the back row. As Molly's father
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: speaks STEPHEN walks in. He sits in the adjacent row - he and Paul look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You always hear people talking about events out of sequence...the order of things. There is no greater grief than a parent laying their child to rest...She was a little girl trying to make it in a very grown up world...a world were every mistake is magnified and she was smart and pretty and so so young. He looks to the PRIEST next to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father, you ask us to accept God's plan, to not question his judgment, with all due respect, I don't accept this judgment. She made the world better, not just for me, but for everyone she touched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're on the street in front of the church. People are filing out. PAUL is waiting next to STEPHEN'S car as Steven walks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should hire Jack for a speech writer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll keep that in mind. Are you here to talk to me? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I'm friends with the family. I got her the internship...known her since she was born.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Governor couldn't make the flight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's meeting with Thompson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at you, all grown up with tits and all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I learned from the best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One day we'll grab a beer and you'll tell me what you had on the Governor that put me out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know I didn't have something on you? They both smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better get going, you've got a campaign to run and I've got offices to go look at.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Farragut North? Paul nods his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice consultant firm right off of K Street. Paul turns to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A million a year and nobody to fuck you over. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds relaxing. Paul, without looking back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doesn't it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: with his WIFE and DAUGHTER, stand at the podium just behind Senator Thompson. There are a few hundred people in attendance, campaign workers, supporters and press.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the right man to lead this great nation of ours in these challenging times and the next President of the United States of America, Governor Mike Morris!...And I ask only one thing, that all of us stand shoulder to shoulder and arm in arm in a united Democratic party. Huge cheers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I strongly urge that the three hundred and fifty-six loyal delegates that I have carried as a badge of honor, throw their support to the Governor. Let's end this primary and get on to the business of 1600 Pennsylvania Ave! More big cheers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. And God bless the United States of America. Thompson turns and shakes the hand of Governor Morris. Morris steps up to the microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Under the following we hear the Governor's speech. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see Satellite trucks, press vehicles, police cars, etc. At a catering truck we see a pair of hands grab some coffee and cookies. This is another young intern, JILL. We follow her across the street and into a door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: & RECEPTION ROOM - CONTINUOUS JILL comes through the door. We follow her through the hallways crowded with television cables and technicians. She makes her way in to a large reception room, where Stephen is watching Governor Morris give his speech. She hands him a coffee. We cut between The Governor and Stephen watching from the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MORRIS Thank you Senator Thompson! Well the polls aren't quite closed, but I want to congratulate Senator Pullman...And his Republican constituents on their win here in Ohio. The room explodes in laughter and applause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MORRIS (CONT'D) Senator Thompson I am honored to stand here today with you. I am humbled by your kind words, thank you. Ladies and gentlemen, today marks the beginning of a fight between two sets of ideals. Either we're going to move forward or were going to live in the past... Either we're going to lead the world in technology, or we are going to bury our heads in the sand... the sands of Saudi Arabia...the sands of Iraq! Either we're going to let greed and corruption ruin our industries and our shorelines or we are going to take back our country! We are not a nation used to coming in second or third... Cheers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: & STAGING ROOM While the Governor's speech continues we stay close on Stephen as he walks through the crowd. We follow him into Governor Morris's staging area. Four monitors on a table show different network feeds. We watch Stephen roll down his sleeves and button his shirt. He ties his tie and puts his jacket on. From the monitors we hear reporters etc. We push in on one of the monitors where DUFFY is being interviewed. As we push in we see STEPHEN cross out of the room. BEN is watching, he looks back and smiles at STEPHEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No it's not decisive, we still have several contests and those states are going to want to have their say. It does look like we'll win Ohio...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you must concede that these three hundred and fifty-six delegates put the pledged delegates out of reach. And with word today that the super delegates are breaking three to one for Morris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We still have a lot of contests Rachel, Ohio is-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well then do you have the funds? As we read it-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course we have the funds. We're getting new donations daily... Our new intern, JILL crosses into frame looking down at BEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey...Ben...I was told to talk to you. I'm supposed to get a phone...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right...you're.... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jill Morris...no relation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you a Bearcat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...I'm from Columbus I'm a Buckeye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A shot of STEPHEN walking across the quad towards the gym.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We pick up Stephen walking with Ida.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're making me look bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How so?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just filed a story that said you were off the campaign and Thompson was going to Pullman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't believe everything you read.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to give you an opportunity to comment on my next story. It says that you delivered Thompson...You got the three hundred and fifty-six delegates, you delivered the nomination. And all you asked in return was Paul's job. Any chance of you confirming that? They approach a security guard standing by a set of double doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No press beyond this point...she's press. I'll read about it in the funny papers. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on Stephen...aren't we friends anymore?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're my best friend Ida. And Stephen walks through the doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A wide shot of the darkened gymnasium. Stephen sits on a stool in front of a camera lit by a single television light. We're now in tight - One PERSON is putting a mic on Stephen while the OTHER is applying make-up. No one speaks. The sound man then puts and earwig into Stephens ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should be able to hear them...do you hear them? We hear the buzzing in his ear of the broadcast from New York.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah I can hear them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good, quick mic check can you count to ten for me? Stephen counts to ten. Everyone stands behind the camera. The sound man with his headset on whispers..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're coming to you in about forty five seconds. We sit in silence staring at Stephens face. Ten seconds - nothing. Twenty seconds - nothing This scene starts to resemble our opening - A dark auditorium - only a few people doing their individual jobs. Stephen looks at two interns holding clipboards and cell phones. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The FIRST AD is sitting on the floor talking on his headset. The CAMERAMAN makes adjustments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sweeping the gym floor in the distance. They all seem to be staring at him. They probably aren't - but he feels it. The enthusiasm and excitement of Stephen has given over to emptiness. The price of winning at all cost. We stay on Stephen's face. We now hear the Governor's speech through Stephen's earwig.
direction.name: direction
